content: http://forums.military.com/eve/forums/a/tpc/f/69719858/m/8460025022001 Posted Sun 12 April 2009 05:59 PM Condensed version from the post by 'fontman': How the rescue happened Posted in Miscellaneous News on 04/12/2009 by Mark Schallow Posted by Uncle Jimbo at BlackFive.net The lifeboat was approx. 25 m behind the Bainbridge when snipers on the fantail observed one of the pirates in the pilot house of the lifeboat pointing an AK-47 ast the back of a tied-up Phillips and the other two pirates on board were visible (at least shoulders and heads). The standing authority gave them clearence to engage the pirates if the life of the captain was in immediate danger. The on scene commander deemed this to be true and gave the order to fire......... This was not a rescue attempt ordered by National Command Authority i.e. the President. It was a reaction by the on scene commander under standard authority to safeguard the life of a hostage. The AP is reporting that President Obama gave the order to use military force to rescue the hostage, this is misleading.... The AP is making it sound that there was an active rescue ordered by the President. It was not, there was an imminent threat and the local commander gave the order to fire. Good on Obama for ensuring their authorization was clear, but let's also be clear that he did not authorize or order an active rescue attempt. uhler... If you took the time and read the link provided earlier...the facts speak for themselves! Oh yes...I beat you by one month!

content: http://forums.military.com/eve/forums/a/tpc/f/69719858/m/8460025022001 Posted Sun 12 April 2009 05:59 PM Condensed version from the post by 'fontman': How the rescue happened Posted in Miscellaneous News on 04/12/2009 by Mark Schallow Posted by Uncle Jimbo at BlackFive.net The lifeboat was approx. 25 m behind the Bainbridge when snipers on the fantail observed one of the pirates in the pilot house of the lifeboat pointing an AK-47 ast the back of a tied-up Phillips and the other two pirates on board were visible (at least shoulders and heads). The standing authority gave them clearence to engage the pirates if the life of the captain was in immediate danger. The on scene commander deemed this to be true and gave the order to fire......... This was not a rescue attempt ordered by National Command Authority i.e. the President. It was a reaction by the on scene commander under standard authority to safeguard the life of a hostage. The AP is reporting that President Obama gave the order to use military force to rescue the hostage, this is misleading.... The AP is making it sound that there was an active rescue ordered by the President. It was not, there was an imminent threat and the local commander gave the order to fire. Good on Obama for ensuring their authorization was clear, but let's also be clear that he did not authorize or order an active rescue attempt. uhler... If you took the time and read the link provided earlier...the facts speak for themselves! Oh yes...I beat you by one month!

content: http://forums.military.com/eve/forums/a/tpc/f/69719858/m/8460025022001 Posted Sun 12 April 2009 05:59 PM Condensed version from the post by 'fontman': How the rescue happened Posted in Miscellaneous News on 04/12/2009 by Mark Schallow Posted by Uncle Jimbo at BlackFive.net The lifeboat was approx. 25 m behind the Bainbridge when snipers on the fantail observed one of the pirates in the pilot house of the lifeboat pointing an AK-47 ast the back of a tied-up Phillips and the other two pirates on board were visible (at least shoulders and heads). The standing authority gave them clearence to engage the pirates if the life of the captain was in immediate danger. The on scene commander deemed this to be true and gave the order to fire......... This was not a rescue attempt ordered by National Command Authority i.e. the President. It was a reaction by the on scene commander under standard authority to safeguard the life of a hostage. The AP is reporting that President Obama gave the order to use military force to rescue the hostage, this is misleading.... The AP is making it sound that there was an active rescue ordered by the President. It was not, there was an imminent threat and the local commander gave the order to fire. Good on Obama for ensuring their authorization was clear, but let's also be clear that he did not authorize or order an active rescue attempt. uhler... If you took the time and read the link provided earlier...the facts speak for themselves! Oh yes...I beat you by one month!

content: http://forums.military.com/eve/forums/a/tpc/f/69719858/m/8460025022001 Posted Sun 12 April 2009 05:59 PM Condensed version from the post by 'fontman': How the rescue happened Posted in Miscellaneous News on 04/12/2009 by Mark Schallow Posted by Uncle Jimbo at BlackFive.net The lifeboat was approx. 25 m behind the Bainbridge when snipers on the fantail observed one of the pirates in the pilot house of the lifeboat pointing an AK-47 ast the back of a tied-up Phillips and the other two pirates on board were visible (at least shoulders and heads). The standing authority gave them clearence to engage the pirates if the life of the captain was in immediate danger. The on scene commander deemed this to be true and gave the order to fire......... This was not a rescue attempt ordered by National Command Authority i.e. the President. It was a reaction by the on scene commander under standard authority to safeguard the life of a hostage. The AP is reporting that President Obama gave the order to use military force to rescue the hostage, this is misleading.... The AP is making it sound that there was an active rescue ordered by the President. It was not, there was an imminent threat and the local commander gave the order to fire. Good on Obama for ensuring their authorization was clear, but let's also be clear that he did not authorize or order an active rescue attempt. uhler... If you took the time and read the link provided earlier...the facts speak for themselves! Oh yes...I beat you by one month!

Look umm, I hate to pollute this thread further, but as one who has been authorized to use "appropriate force", I can pretty much tell you it's a legal cop out, as appropriate force is always determined later. Had the Captain been killed in the exchange, you surely would have heard, "I authorized the use of appropriate force and clearly this wasn't." The Captain of the Bainbridge made the call, "Kill them now." Where he was "at" and Where Obama was "at" are two entirely different places. Authorizing appropriate force is not definitely authorizing the use of deadly force, and the thing that burns me, is that this is being reported as a negotiation gone wrong, with the Navy pulling the fish out of the fire. This was not a planned rescue attempt, as I believe it should have been...three days ago. If someone had authorized deadly force. And he sums it up with the line, "We need the world's help dealing with these pirates." Certainly the world needs to be involved in anti-piracy ops. They have been. It is a combined fleet that patrols those waters. But it seems to me like the world once again needed our help to show them how to deal with their issues. The frikin' cowboy way. God bless the Captain of Bainbridge and those snipers. It isn't like they had the MSM spin machine in their pocket to clarify any "misperception of mistakes" when they made their momentous decision to shoot. It is an awesome American Navy day. Let's let it be that.

content: http://forums.military.com/eve/forums/a/tpc/f/69719858/m/8460025022001 Posted Sun 12 April 2009 05:59 PM Condensed version from the post by 'fontman': How the rescue happened Posted in Miscellaneous News on 04/12/2009 by Mark Schallow Posted by Uncle Jimbo at BlackFive.net The lifeboat was approx. 25 m behind the Bainbridge when snipers on the fantail observed one of the pirates in the pilot house of the lifeboat pointing an AK-47 ast the back of a tied-up Phillips and the other two pirates on board were visible (at least shoulders and heads). The standing authority gave them clearence to engage the pirates if the life of the captain was in immediate danger. The on scene commander deemed this to be true and gave the order to fire......... This was not a rescue attempt ordered by National Command Authority i.e. the President. It was a reaction by the on scene commander under standard authority to safeguard the life of a hostage. The AP is reporting that President Obama gave the order to use military force to rescue the hostage, this is misleading.... The AP is making it sound that there was an active rescue ordered by the President. It was not, there was an imminent threat and the local commander gave the order to fire. Good on Obama for ensuring their authorization was clear, but let's also be clear that he did not authorize or order an active rescue attempt. uhler... If you took the time and read the link provided earlier...the facts speak for themselves! Oh yes...I beat you by one month!
